revised_title: Palaeoecological Investigations and Neolithic-Bronze Age Settlement in County Tyrone, Northern Ireland
tldr: This study investigates the history of the Ballynagilly site, a Neolithic and Bronze Age settlement in County Tyrone, Northern Ireland, through stratigraphic investigations, pollen analysis, and radiocarbon dating. The research examines the area's vegetational history and correlates it with the prehistoric occupations, revealing evidence of forest clearance, different types of agriculture, and changes in the landscape over time.
